that's pretty based but in 1994 he was
arrested for selling hacked phone
numbers then convicted of more hacking
charges in '98 but never did any
significant jail time because the judge
chocked it up to youthful foolishness he
then pushed his luck further in 2001
when he bought a bankrupt website called
let's bu it.com during the dotcom crash
he told everyone he was going to pump a
bunch of money into it and after the
stock went up he dumped it for a quick
profit he was doing pump and dump rug
pools before they were cool he tried to
move to Thailand and fake his own death
but once again was arrested and once
again received a suspended sentence and
despite his convictions he eventually
immigrated to New Zealand on an investor
visa and that brings us to 2005 and the
rise of Kim's Mega Empire it was a
collection of websites that did
everything from Payment Processing to
philanthropy but its core service was
file uploads like a precursor to Dropbox
or Google Drive its html-based UI was
faster and easier than iTunes but most
importantly allowed anyone to upload
extremely large files these uploads
could be paused and resumed and each
download would generate a unique link
that could be shared with your friends
and they were able to scale to a massive
level with techniques like file D
duplication where a hash is generated
for a file so if you try to upload the
same pirated Seinfeld episode twice it
only actually takes up the space of one
file Mega also had a certain level of
security and encryption to protect user
data but it wasn't totally Anonymous and
after the seizure none of the users got
their data back although mega upload
continues to live on as Mega nowadays
Mega uses zero knowledge encryption
where data is encrypted on both the
client and the server so no third party
including Mega can know what you
uploaded what was absolutely genius
though is that mega upload had an
affiliate program that rewarded users
for generating downloads which
eventually snowballed into Mega
accounting for 4% of global internet
traffic and wheelbarrows filled with
money for Kim unfortunately the party
came to an end in 2012 when the website
was shut down the servers were seized
and Kim's New Zealand Mansion was raid
they took everything including his

there's multiple philosophical debates
